postcss.eli5: PostCSS is like a magic tool that cleans and upgrades your CSS before it’s used.
postcss.boss: PostCSS is a tool that processes CSS with plugins to transform, optimize, and extend stylesheets for better performance and compatibility.
postcss.sysadmin: PostCSS parses CSS into an abstract syntax tree (AST) and allows transformation via plugins like Autoprefixer or nesting rules before bundling.
postcss.use_case: Used to add vendor prefixes and minify CSS before shipping to production.

autoprefixer.eli5: It’s a tool that adds the right browser labels to your CSS so it works everywhere.
autoprefixer.boss: Autoprefixer automatically adds vendor-specific prefixes to CSS rules based on browser compatibility data.
autoprefixer.sysadmin: Autoprefixer is a PostCSS plugin that uses data from Can I Use to insert required prefixes (e.g., -webkit-) during CSS compilation.
autoprefixer.use_case: Used to ensure flexbox layouts work across Safari, Chrome, and Firefox.

tailwindcss.eli5: Tailwind is like LEGO blocks for websites—you stack utility classes to build designs fast.
tailwindcss.boss: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first framework that lets developers rapidly build designs using small, reusable class names.
tailwindcss.sysadmin: Tailwind is a PostCSS-based CSS framework offering atomic class utilities for styling, with support for responsive, hover, and theme customization.
tailwindcss.use_case: Used to quickly prototype and build responsive UIs using utility classes.
